column5: What a nice day on the lake today...even a bit windy but almost no slush and definitely no snow left...lot of water draining into the holes though....should make for a nice drive next week when it all freezes.  Started about 8:30...and got a quick laker and missed a whitie....then Rick got his whitie....and we kept marking them but they were not very aggressive...so Rick took the executive decision to move at 10am.....and it was the right decision too....  Found the hungry ones....and finish the double limit quickly and have released many more to swim and get bigger until next time  The tech info from the day:  88 fow, 90% of the fish caught on Meegs....few were caught on Williams...  Here is the shot of the day courtesy of Rick's camera... Finally my fish to look as clean and washed as Ricks ha ha ha    Cheers, Ice Fisherman
Nice Emil... how was travel out there??
Ahhhh man thats nice! You got me goin now, wanna get whitefish again!  Cool report, hope the wind drops here for the weekend...its been gusting upto 70kmh here   NASTY!
nice going  the wind is nasty, it has screwed up tomorrows trip  but sunday
Glad to see the conditions are still good.  Nice fish and thanks for the report!

Very easy going Wayne....lots of water but it is draining in the wholes...and all snow is gone and almost all slush is gone as well...couple days of cold temps and it'll be the best ice to travel this year. ATV's and sleds all over the ice today....need good dry boots though...and cleats too   Yep it sure was windy but don't mind the wind when temp is 12 degrees By the way with all you great eyes fishery up there I envy you big time... Lets trade a whities Simcoe trip for an eye one up your way  Cheers, Emil
Great report Emil, and thanks for the lake conditions update too.  Joey
Nice fish!!! Sounds like the perfect weather conditions to wet the lines Great report and thanks for sharing icefisherman Leechman
Looks great Emil. Hope the ice is that good next weekend for Fishing For Tyler.
If anything it should be better next weekend Bruce...  Cheers, Ice Fisherman
Nice to hear all the snow and slush are on their way out..  Even the ATV's were having a tough go of it a few weeks ago.
Nice work Emil! Sounds like moving around works. Did you have to move very far and did you go from deeper to shallower?  Thanks, Rob C
Rob we moved about 3 miles only once...but the depth remained the same 88 fow.  Cheers, Ice Fisherman
Great Report Emil.. Glad to see your locating them.. Nice fish..
Once, again, nicely done Emil!!!!!  You definitely have Simcoe dialed in  With the storm moving in tonight, looks like "the Lady" will have to wait for another week for me
